alert.note: Alert for Milwaukee; Racine; Walworth; Waukesha (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 12 at 12:50AM CDT until further notice by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Wisconsin, including the following counties, Kenosha, Milwaukee, Racine, Walworth and Waukesha. * WHEN...Until 300 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1243 AM CDT, Multiple broadcast media partners reported standing water in several yards and standing water roads with cars inundated around the Racine area. Observations and reports of between 3 and 7.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of up to around 1 inch will be possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Milwaukee, Kenosha, Racine, Waukesha, West Allis, New Berlin, Brookfield, Greenfield, Oak Creek, Mount Pleasant, Muskego, South Milwaukee, Pleasant Prairie, Cudahy, Greendale, Pewaukee, Elkhorn, St. Francis, Hales Corners and Lake Geneva. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
